fields.title: Ben Westwood
fields.content:
Popular talented singer-songwriter returns to Printers with great original music and top covers in his own style! Ben will be supported by his friend, fellow singer-songwriter Scott Doane.

www,facebook.com/benwestwoodmusic
www.benwestwoodmusic.com
Tickets £5

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: Singer-songwriter Ben Westwood performs as a duo with multi-instrumentalist Scott Doane, playing a range of acoustic originals and covers that blend folk, blues, rock and soul.

fields.title: Marky Dawson
fields.content:
Marky started teaching himself piano at the age of 14. After moving to London, Marky was soon a regular on the circuit working as resident pianist in pubs and bars, entertaining audiences with his wide repertoire of covers and catchy originals.

Playing in his unique style of energetic piano based Rock 'n' Roll, Marky doesn't use backing tracks: it's all live and he's happy to take requests. After all, with a song list covering 7 decades there's a pretty good chance he'll know the song you love!
Tickets £5

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: Marky started teaching himself piano at the age of 14. After moving to London, Marky was soon a regular on the circuit working as resident pianist in pubs and bars, entertaining audiences with his wide repertoire of covers and catchy originals.

fields.title: Leading Ladies
fields.content:
Join Helen Ward - Jackson and Natalie Roberts for a night at the musicals.

Featuring songs from all your favourite West End and Broadway leading ladies.

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: Join Helen Ward - Jackson and Natalie Roberts for a night at the musicals.

fields.title: Open Stage
fields.content:
The best open mic in Eastbourne. 

Free entry and first act from 8pm.

All musicians welcome! All poets welcome! All storytellers welcome! All comedians welcome!

Ticket MUST be booked in advance. £10 holding deposits for tables.

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: Musicians, poets, storytellers, comedians are all welcome! Basically anyone who needs a mic to express their art.

fields.title: Holding Space
fields.content:
If you are a parent/carer looking after a child who is struggling with their mental health why not pop in and meet other parents. 

Relaxed group offering a safe, confidential space; time to chat, connect and share with one another. Know that you are not alone as a parent.

Holding Space is a free Monthly group starting Thursday May 20th 10am-11.30am
fields.excerpt: If you are a parent/carer looking after a child who is struggling with their mental health why not pop in and meet other parents.

fields.title: Beginers Yoga
fields.content:
Ashley from Lotus Lessons will support you through a gentle chair based practice that is focused on mindful movement and meditation.

Sessions are accessible for all with modifications given where needed. 

Beginners Yoga - Weekly £10 Thur May 20th 10.30am-11.30am
fields.excerpt: Ashley from Lotus Lessons will support you through a gentle chair based practice that is focused on mindful movement and meditation.

fields.title: Hidden Worlds
fields.content:
Make a window into a hidden world with art tutor and theatre designer 
Lucy Dean. 

Theatrical scenes in a closed box,  viewed through a peephole.
theatrical self expression in a box! 

Hidden Worlds - 6 Weeks £60 total/£10 a session
Starting Wednesday May 19th 2pm-3.30pm
fields.excerpt: Make a window into a hidden world with art tutor and theatre designer Lucy Dean.

fields.title: Happenings
fields.content:
In these tough times, Life’s a struggle. There’s unfulfilled expectations. Humdrum existences needing an injection of life. Millions wishing something, would happen to them, to fill the void in their lives. Clearly everyone “else” is happy. Online celebrations and holiday pics prove it. Jane can’t take it anymore. She needs that something, anything! but how far is she willing to go to get it?

If you purchased a ticket or tickets for the original run of Happenings at the Grove in December 2020, but were unable to attend on account of being resident in a then-Tier 3 or 4 area, you may exchange your ticket(s) for either of these two performances. Please contact us at grovetheatreeastbourne@gmail.com for your exchange to be processed. This does not apply to those who received refunds on their tickets.
fields.excerpt:
Printers at the Grove
A new play by John Berry

fields.title: Treble Twenty
fields.content:
We are thrilled that on our opening weekend we will be presenting a brand new two hander Treble Twenty, a fantastic new PPH production and our first piece of theatre this year. We are also delighted that Script Works Productions are filming it, so that as well as being a COVID secure bubbled live production, it will also be available online!

Roy is an old fashioned, red faced bigot of a man with opinions that could make Alf Garnett look prudish. His teammate is Jim, a man who has been biting his tongue for so long that he is in danger of severing it. The only thing these two men have in common is their weekly darts game, as they prepare for the forthcoming Foyle’s Cup tensions begin to mount. Could this be their last game or will someone 180?

Written by: Scott Kingsnorth
Matthew Devitt - Roy
Karl Williamson - Jim
Directed by: John Berry
Gino Isaacs - Filming

Limited tickets available for this Covid secure event so book now. 

Tickets £14 each Concession available 

Should this event need to be postponed tickets will be transferable.

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt:
Printers at the Grove
A new play by Scott Kingsnorth

fields.title: 10 Week Actor Training
fields.content:
An introduction to actor training, this demanding course nurtures students through a
life-changing journey, in which they are challenged to achieve their full potential as actors and
acquire skills for working in the full range of acting contexts.

The aim is to introduce the art of acting to adults (aged 18 and over) at a totally professional level. Run
by seasoned professional actors and theatre directors.

We will explore:
● Acting technique
● Voice training
● Movement training
● Improvisation
● Characterisation
● Script analysis
● Rehearsal technique
● Screen Acting

The courses are prepared with the students in mind, and are designed to ensure that you gain
as much as possible from the training you receive.

10th May - 19th July (one week break for half term)

Please email us on info@printersplayhouse.co.uk to book your place.

All events and workshops are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’
The course can be split into the three elements and attended and paid for separately.

Voice and Text £200
Acting £200
Acting for Screen £200
Full Discounted Price for all three elements £525

To book your place on the course please fill in the attached application form and send it with
£50 non refundable deposit to secure your place.

Course fees are split into two payment installments 50% payable before the course starts and
the remaining 50% by June 21st

Other payment plans may be made if necessary so please contact us to discuss this.

If current Covid 19 circumstances prevent the workshops from happening at the designated
times, please be assured that they will be reinstated at a later date. The course will be completed.
fields.excerpt:
An introduction to actor training, this demanding course nurtures students through a
life-changing journey, in which they are challenged to achieve their full potential as actors and
acquire skills for working in the full range of acting contexts.

fields.title: Big Al Arcane and the Nightrider
fields.content:
Join big Al Arcane and the Nightrider for a COVID Safe performance!

Big Al's musical project is to blend traditional Rhythm 'n Blues with modern styling to create an inclusion that celebrates cultural variety. He enjoys roots music; blues, boogie and the jazz developed from these influences.

Tickets £5

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: Join big Al Arcane and the Nightrider for a COVID Safe performance!

fields.title: Collage Club
fields.content:
All abilities welcome to experiment with collage and make art in a supportive environment. 

Join Sarah in using found and made collage materials to explore creative expression.

fields.title: Coffee Morning
fields.content:
Coffee and catch up for over 50’s – a chance to enjoy a cuppa and a catch up.

Coffee Group is free and will meet monthly from Wednesday May 19th 10am-12noon
fields.excerpt: Coffee and catch up for over 50’s – a chance to enjoy a cuppa and a catch up.

fields.title: Book Club
fields.content:
Join a relaxed group of like minded locals interested in having a natter about a good book! 

Come along to the first session to discuss what books we enjoy and what we would to read. Books will be chosen by consensus. 

PPH Book Club  is a monthly free group meeting from Wednesday June 2nd 10.30 - 11.30
fields.excerpt: Join a relaxed group of like minded locals interested in having a natter about a good book!

fields.title: The Great Fire
fields.content:
The Great Fire are an energetic 4-piece function band playing an eclectic, electric playlist from more than five decades of party music. Our foot-stomping live act is full of infectious, sing-along melodies and highly dance-able tunes that are guaranteed to get you on the dance floor.

The band have carefully curated a list of songs from over five decades of music. These aren't your standard cover band songs; while we love playing cover band classics and crowd pleasers, you're equally likely to find us playing something that's currently on the radio.
fields.excerpt: With support from Deano and the Danglers
